Vector grassmann::solve ( Matrix  a,
Vector  coeff 
) throw (NotSquareMatrixException, UndefinedSystemException)

Solves a linear system, for which is given the matrix a of variables' coefficients and the vector coeff of numeric coefficients.

To be done if and only if the matrix is not singular and the vector does not contain null values. For example, let's consider the linear system

		x1 + x2 + x3 = 6
 		2*x1 + x2 - x3 = 1
 		x1 + x2 + 2*x3 = 9

Then, A will be

 		(1  1  1)
 		(2  1 -1)
 		(1  1  2)

and coeff will be (6,1,9) A vector containing the solution (1,2,3) will be returned

Parameters:
coeff Vector of numeric coefficients
a Matrix containing the coefficients of the variables
Returns:
A vector containing, if the system is possible and the solution is unique, the solution for the system
Exceptions:
NotSquareMatrixException If trying to compute the determinant of a non-square matrix
UndefinedSystemException If the system is undefined
